Don't insult these youngsters. Please do constrictive criticism. Actually their acting is good. People get frustrated and we must not insult people. People who commented here do u like if someone insults ur children. Shame on u guys. Don't behave like this.

True.. I do not understand why people compare Devni Inima with Kumbiyo. Those are two different dramas with two different themes and contents. Devani inima is a local mega drama. Kumbiyo is a regular political drama. Even Bolywood and Hoollywood have classics as well as commercial oriented productions. Our people are so narrow minded. They think all the dramas should be political and regular. Where is the variety?

Funny how you chose to class political dramas as regular. Completely understand your point but do not agree with your figure of speech. Regular is mainstream, rather ‚Äúrun of the mill‚Äù, mediocre. I don‚Äôt think you could class the likes of Koombiyo or Sahodarayo as mainstream or ‚Äúrun of the mill‚Äù or mediocre. Yes, there should be variety as our society is made up of heads of different levels of education, sophistication. A person who will appreciate Koombiyo may not appreciate Dewani Inima and that isn‚Äôt a crime or anything to worry about, but sadness is when a person who appreciates Dewani Inima cannot appreciate or grasp Koombiyo. That means their thought process is stuck in a rut and will not evolve, mature or arise to any levels of sophistication.
Regular as opposed to mega duh !
Variety. See whether you have a brain.
fully agreed
For what?
to above comment of Mavsn

Dear Raween, I'm very sad to see this comments. I think is not what the majority thinks. You went to Australia, Cyprus and France, you saw how much you were loved in these countries. You have to remember that when you see these bad comments and a lot of people want to be where you are and they can't. They don't get the love you get, this is the main reason behind this criticism. Just think that they are talking about themselves. All the best to you, be strong and walk your path, theres a lot of people who love you and believe in you. Their clapping is enough for now, this same people will appreciate your work years from now.

I think you are missing the point here. Do you think each and every one commenting on this thread wants to walk in this actor‚Äôs shoes? Do you really think they are all jealous or something? Then how come they aren‚Äôt criticising Thumidu Dodantenna? Going by your logic, no one wants to be in Thumidu‚Äôs shoes, hence he is not criticised? No one wants to be talented, popular, good looking, sophisticated, educated, well travelled like Thumindu? Is that what you mean? I think it is fans like you who mislead our youth. If you are a true fan you don‚Äôt follow them blindly you actually criticise them constructively. This young man is a fairly good actor, good looking yet there was someone better than him. So what you need to let him know is that you cannot win always but rather aspire to reach the heights of the winner. Just don‚Äôt push him further deep in to his bubble, when it bursts they suffer.

Sorry I haven't answered your question. I'm not talking about everyone in this thread but some comments I've seen in various threads. You think the name calling and non conservative insults are ok? I was talking about the people who do that . Yes I think the people who do such things wanted to walk in his shoes but couldn't. He is still the second best every time. That means one of the most popular.

I haven't mentioned Tumindu here. I don't bash one person to show other person is better. This time Tumindu was the winner no doubt about that, others didn't stand a chance because of Koombiyo, such a good drama. I was addressing Raween because I felt sad about the way some people have written rude comments. These are real people. most of the criticism is non constructive pointless insults. I stand by the youngster. It's my choice. Thumidu is already on top anyway if he got the Raigam or not. He doesn't need my encouragement, I congratulate him. I'm sure Raween congratulated him from the heart as he's such a humble person.
You cannot hide gems forever. Someday someone will find them and give to real value for them.

Monawa wunath Anuhas/ Samalka/ Jehan... Kiyanne Charitha witharayi. Charitha kiyanne egollange pudgalika jeewithe nemei. Charitha mawanne thira rachakayane. Jehan wadakarayek (smart ) wunata Thumidu ehema nowennath, Anuhas bolanda charithayak wunata Raveen esema nowennath puluwan. Thira rachanawe adi adi thiyena bolanda charitha ranga panawa kiyala e kollo kellanta baninna epa. Ko jathyalaya / ko sinhalakama?? Mona wunath Indian jarawal walata wada lankawe bihiwunu Honda take drama 2 k ne deweni inimayi/ Koombiyo yi. Api nam oya dekama baluwa. Rasa windada. Deshapalane wagema moda minissu dekata bedila banagattata, godak nalu nuliyo e dekama rangapawa. Lankawe minissunge thawa kenekuge adahas walata garu karana eke NIL.

Hariyata hari. Mathakada kubiyo eke jehan poth vikunana wadeta kollo set ekak genawa. Unta wachanayak mis unu gaman ana kotaa gannawaa. Anna e wage thamayi me samahara prekshakayo. Owunge apuru rasikathwaya monawata widhaha paanawa !
Pandithayeki.

I have watched nearly all or most of the tele-drama since 1984. The good ones are yasoraavaya, Kadulla, all those done by Naalan Mendis, Pabaa, Saraa, Nethu, all those short ones by Asoka Handagama, Deveni Inima, Pini, Muthu kuda, Sal Sapuna, Koombiyo, Bohimiyanuwa etc Recently the best ones are Deveni Inima, Sal Sapuna, Koombiyo, Pini, Bohimiyanuwa, Nethu etc. No one should try to compare these and say A is better than B etc, all are different ones giving differernt message to society while engaging best of the artists It is like trying to compare Kumar Sangakkara, Roger Federer, Tiger Wood, Ronaldo, Chamari Athapattu, Susanthika J etc
